commit_message:
Use assertFalse(observed) instead of assertEqual(False, observed)

The patch also improves the way in which the assertTrue (and
similarly assertFalse) are done,

We should use assertFalse not assertEqual.

Co-Authored-By: Gary Kotton <gkotton@vmware.com>

Closes-Bug: #1503074

Change-Id: I5f527ddf2ca522cdf101de2482d59f059eca010f

subject: Choose virt type automatically
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-11 01:58:35.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_nova/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_nova/tasks/nova_compute.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_nova/tasks/nova_post_install.yml'], 'message': 'Choose virt type automatically

If nova_virt_type variable is not defined in defaults/main.yml,
Using command "egrep -c '(vmx|svm)' /proc/cpuinfo" in
deploy environment, it can easily tell us what the right
virt_type is according to the return value.

If this command returns a value of one or greater, your
compute node supports hardware acceleration and just set
virt_type = kvm.

If this command returns a value of zero, your compute node
does not support hardware acceleration and you must configure
virt_type = qemu instead of kvm.

Change-Id: I6e36ffcb56d50556df0803aea9f4cd7850fada5a
'}]
commit_message:
Choose virt type automatically

If nova_virt_type variable is not defined in defaults/main.yml,
Using command "egrep -c '(vmx|svm)' /proc/cpuinfo" in
deploy environment, it can easily tell us what the right
virt_type is according to the return value.

If this command returns a value of one or greater, your
compute node supports hardware acceleration and just set
virt_type = kvm.

If this command returns a value of zero, your compute node
does not support hardware acceleration and you must configure
virt_type = qemu instead of kvm.

Change-Id: I6e36ffcb56d50556df0803aea9f4cd7850fada5a

subject: Added logging for haproxy to rsyslog
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-27 20:01:17.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/handlers/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/haproxy-install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/tasks/haproxy_post_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/tasks/haproxy_pre_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/files/haproxy-logging.cfg'], 'message': 'Added logging for haproxy to rsyslog

The change adds logging for haproxy on localhost through the use
of rsyslog which is now a dependency. The logs will be stored in
/var/log/haproxy which will later be indexed and shipped to the
logging server. The change makes it possible to debug issues with
haproxy using specific log files instead of having to go digging
through syslog.

Change-Id: Id942ce159ea45703259f7aff0e5a85780a83370b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>'}]
commit_message:
Added logging for haproxy to rsyslog

The change adds logging for haproxy on localhost through the use
of rsyslog which is now a dependency. The logs will be stored in
/var/log/haproxy which will later be indexed and shipped to the
logging server. The change makes it possible to debug issues with
haproxy using specific log files instead of having to go digging
through syslog.

Change-Id: Id942ce159ea45703259f7aff0e5a85780a83370b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Remove TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR in the api tox env""

This reverts commit a3154b03ac60df586bd8fd67f03c20327f2dde41.

The revert was merged too quickly, without waiting for tox project to fix us.
The gate passed for the revert only because infra folks removed images
that had new tox in them. We will be broken by the next images though.

Change-Id: I148c80e5b9512fee280ecbf3ca7498ddf1cfd96d

commit_message:
fix heat stable/kilo gate

heat functional jobs were switched to use Aodh which is alarming
functionality split from Ceilometer. this split was only done in
Liberty so Juno and Kilo branches should continue to use Ceilometer
for alarming.

commit_message:
Creation of the tools-contrib repo.

This review creates the tools-contrib directory where it will be a place
to contribute any tool, script, or the like to the OSOps project. The
rename of the tools-generic as a Curated place, is where we plan on
putting coding standards and testing around the tools.

These both were discussed in Tokyo, and decided that we needed a place
for each type.

Change-Id: If8c848fcac4e1a86e0d381883b87cf9dbfdf8b36

subject: Update virtualenv, pip and git existent check in cli-ref tool
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-13 07:43:50.000000000', 'files': ['bin/doc-tools-update-cli-reference'], 'message': 'Update virtualenv, pip and git existent check in cli-ref tool

In the cli auto generation tool default,
it uses /usr/bin only for virtualenv, pip and git
But ubuntu server installs these two commands to
/usr/local/bin.

This patch searches these commands by the which command.
If it cannot find these commands in the search path,
it reports error.

Closes-Bug: #1515878
Change-Id: I61ed42d27724a5abb72748beb58c1c012c52a3f6
'}]
commit_message:
Update virtualenv, pip and git existent check in cli-ref tool

In the cli auto generation tool default,
it uses /usr/bin only for virtualenv, pip and git
But ubuntu server installs these two commands to
/usr/local/bin.

This patch searches these commands by the which command.
If it cannot find these commands in the search path,
it reports error.

Closes-Bug: #1515878
Change-Id: I61ed42d27724a5abb72748beb58c1c012c52a3f6

commit_message:
Drop root privileges for rabbitmq

Drop root privileges for rabbitmq.  Only the rabbitmq user
will be able to execute chown of /var/lib/rabbitmq.

Change-Id: I546e6b475a8462bfbc75972854e1fee64f96d9cb

commit_message:
Update etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample

This updates etc/ironic/ironic.conf.sample to include the config
'graceful_shutdown_timeout' and to indicate that the port-related
configs expect port values instead of integer values.

The .sample file is updated via running 'tox -egenconfig'.

Change-Id: Id297ee0b095c69491d31fd66261423f0f739fe11

commit_message:
Use assertFalse instead of assertEqual

As the changes have been made for use of assertFalse over assertEqual
for matching false. This patch will do the same change in some
statements which were not covered by previous patches.

subject: Allow DHCP responses to reach clients.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-12 15:51:23.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'networking_ovn/plugin.py'], 'message': "Allow DHCP responses to reach clients.

When security groups were first implemented in this plugin, I had to put
a hack in our custom branch of OVS that made DHCP packets bypass
conntrack.  This issue has now been debugged and fixed.

Part of this patch is switching our default OVS branch to one without
the DHCP hack. We still require a custom branch because we need patches
for the kernel backport of ovs+conntrack integration.  This backport is
up for review so we should be back to OVS master soon.

The first part of the DHCP problem was a bug in ovs conntrack
integration that resulted in the DHCP request not making it to the DHCP
server at all in some cases.  The fix is here:

    https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/e37b8437e915a02a88116e5ea7af1a7e716bd597

The second part of the DHCP problem is that because of how DHCP works,
it's not a point to point connection that can be tracked and
automatically let responses through.  Instead, we need to explicitly
allow DHCP server responses to reach clients.  This is likely temporary
and can be removed once OVN's native DHCP support is merged.

Change-Id: If14a64af7eba61c8cab752adfbdf8171d0ab2d3a
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Allow DHCP responses to reach clients.

When security groups were first implemented in this plugin, I had to put
a hack in our custom branch of OVS that made DHCP packets bypass
conntrack.  This issue has now been debugged and fixed.

Part of this patch is switching our default OVS branch to one without
the DHCP hack. We still require a custom branch because we need patches
for the kernel backport of ovs+conntrack integration.  This backport is
up for review so we should be back to OVS master soon.

The first part of the DHCP problem was a bug in ovs conntrack
integration that resulted in the DHCP request not making it to the DHCP
server at all in some cases.  The fix is here:

    https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/e37b8437e915a02a88116e5ea7af1a7e716bd597

The second part of the DHCP problem is that because of how DHCP works,
it's not a point to point connection that can be tracked and
automatically let responses through.  Instead, we need to explicitly
allow DHCP server responses to reach clients.  This is likely temporary
and can be removed once OVN's native DHCP support is merged.

Change-Id: If14a64af7eba61c8cab752adfbdf8171d0ab2d3a
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR in the api tox env

Setting TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR in tox.ini is breaking the gate,
probably because of a tox bug [1].
Removing the line to unblock the gate. This implies that
for local execution of the tests TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR
should be set manually.

[1] https://bitbucket.org/hpk42/tox/issues/285/tox-220-breaks-some-toxini-config-files

Closes-bug: #1515335

Change-Id: I62f7985b034d17626a45ad965265111b671a5974
(cherry picked from commit ad815651de98580afeca6d56319f8c8a50a357e7)

subject: [install] Remove RDO ceilometer swift support
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-12 00:36:28.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_ceilometer-swift.xml', 'doc/install-guide/ch_ceilometer.xml'], 'message': "[install] Remove RDO ceilometer swift support

In Kilo, RDO does not package python-ceilometermiddleware
that swift requires for ceilometer integration. For some
reason, the guide suggests using 'pip' to install it which
breaks Python packages managed by the distribution package
management system. Only reasonable solution involves disabling
ceilometer swift support on distributions using RDO packages.

Change-Id: I0364e1a2a1cbf73a9f081b033df61c31de752c61
Closes-Bug: #1514844
"}]
commit_message:
[install] Remove RDO ceilometer swift support

In Kilo, RDO does not package python-ceilometermiddleware
that swift requires for ceilometer integration. For some
reason, the guide suggests using 'pip' to install it which
breaks Python packages managed by the distribution package
management system. Only reasonable solution involves disabling
ceilometer swift support on distributions using RDO packages.

Change-Id: I0364e1a2a1cbf73a9f081b033df61c31de752c61
Closes-Bug: #1514844

commit_message:
Configure horizon with identity v3

Currently horizon configures keystone using v3 only if v2 is not
available. Really we should just always be using v3.

Change-Id: Icac4d90b617209da75abf33f8e25ffc021c45fdb

subject: Set ilo driver to utilize local web server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-07 05:20:53.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/ironic_config.yml'], 'message': 'Set ilo driver to utilize local web server

The ilo driver is inherintly dependent upon swift being available,
so in order to run the server in stand-alone mode with the driver,
we need to set the driver to utilize the local webserver for virtual
media.

Change-Id: I00dd7bcc87a07d0c72d3870461bf8ade9b416a54
'}]
commit_message:
Set ilo driver to utilize local web server

The ilo driver is inherintly dependent upon swift being available,
so in order to run the server in stand-alone mode with the driver,
we need to set the driver to utilize the local webserver for virtual
media.

Change-Id: I00dd7bcc87a07d0c72d3870461bf8ade9b416a54

commit_message:
Add reno for release-notes

Add reno to automatically generate release notes - the same way other
OpenStack projects do it.
For details see
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/078301.html

This adds a version.py file to request the version of the repo.

Change-Id: Ia009f4cf73bd4188af3a126123d688438b97c994

commit_message:
Fix cli-package name check

Replace from -eq to ==,
since this comparison is string (i.e. "gnocchi").

Ref.
https://www.gnu.org/software/bash/manual/bash.html#Bash-Conditional-Expressions

Change-Id: If1ed25cee35d6e735c47dca3eea53a3a062ab024
Closes-Bug: #1515842

subject: Close EC fragment iterators in the GreenThread that's consuming them
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-13 02:30:38.000000000', 'files': ['swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/base.py'], 'message': "Close EC fragment iterators in the GreenThread that's consuming them

Otherwise, we might try to close them while they're already running.
This should prevent conditional SLO requests from returning 500 when
they should have returned 304 or 412.

Change-Id: I075a892f901c18ab5c178c9c4a2f367b76ae78e2
Related-Change: I156d873c72c19623bcfbf39bf120c98800b3cada
"}]
commit_message:
Close EC fragment iterators in the GreenThread that's consuming them

Otherwise, we might try to close them while they're already running.
This should prevent conditional SLO requests from returning 500 when
they should have returned 304 or 412.

Change-Id: I075a892f901c18ab5c178c9c4a2f367b76ae78e2
Related-Change: I156d873c72c19623bcfbf39bf120c98800b3cada

commit_message:
pass modal argument when querying for arity

Currently, modal argument is ignored always when getting arity.
This causes error and unable to get the arity for the table with
modal. This commit addresses the issue.

Closes-Bug:#1454844
Change-Id: I40218c4e81b912eb3925259612bccc2db36675d4

subject: Add OpenID Connect RP Apache Module
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-10-09 15:12:10.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_keystone/templates/keystone-httpd.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/load_federation_sp_facts.yml', 'etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/templates/keystone.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_apache.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_keystone/tasks/keystone_federation_sp_idp_setup.yml'], 'message': 'Add OpenID Connect RP Apache Module

This patch set adds bits to configure the OpenID Connect
relying party apache module.
This is so any OpenID Connect provider may be used as an
identity provider with federated keystone.

There were a few changes in the logic to make this work.

* keystone_federated_auth_methods variable was added so the
  user can specify supported federated auth modules. The code
  also uses this variable to determine if the oidc apache
  module directives will be applied (it looks for oidc).

* keystone_federated_saml_implementations variable was added
  to help with applying the right apache module configs. This
  is a list of saml implementations that is used to apply the
  corresponding apache configs. Currently only Shibboleth is
  supported.

* Before, the code would check if keystone_sp object is defined
  then apply the Shibboleth apache configs. Now, the variables
  mentioned above will help with deciding which apache configs to
  apply.

* The mod_auth_openidc module uses the memcached servers to for
  caching data to use across multiple keystone nodes.

Other changes:

* Added example trusted_idp_list entry for the google OIDC server.

* Moved the keystone_sp docs to user_variables.yml

* Loading keystone_sp facts earlier in the playbooks.
  That way we can take advantage of those facts in the subsequent
  plays.

All feedback welcome!

Change-Id: I18ed0b76d0066ea52a0bd677ee01ffde45fa9de9
'}]
commit_message:
Add OpenID Connect RP Apache Module

This patch set adds bits to configure the OpenID Connect
relying party apache module.
This is so any OpenID Connect provider may be used as an
identity provider with federated keystone.

There were a few changes in the logic to make this work.

* keystone_federated_auth_methods variable was added so the
  user can specify supported federated auth modules. The code
  also uses this variable to determine if the oidc apache
  module directives will be applied (it looks for oidc).

* keystone_federated_saml_implementations variable was added
  to help with applying the right apache module configs. This
  is a list of saml implementations that is used to apply the
  corresponding apache configs. Currently only Shibboleth is
  supported.

* Before, the code would check if keystone_sp object is defined
  then apply the Shibboleth apache configs. Now, the variables
  mentioned above will help with deciding which apache configs to
  apply.

* The mod_auth_openidc module uses the memcached servers to for
  caching data to use across multiple keystone nodes.

Other changes:

* Added example trusted_idp_list entry for the google OIDC server.

* Moved the keystone_sp docs to user_variables.yml

* Loading keystone_sp facts earlier in the playbooks.
  That way we can take advantage of those facts in the subsequent
  plays.

All feedback welcome!

Change-Id: I18ed0b76d0066ea52a0bd677ee01ffde45fa9de9

commit_message:
Add extract_kwargs functions to utils.py

Add extract_kwargs functiosn to utils.py, and use it for cluster.
For following kwargs:
{
  'foo': None
}

kwargs.get('foo', 'bar') will return None

New added function will return 'bar'.
extract_kwargs({'foo': None}, key='foo', default='bar')

Change-Id: Ic822618f47d66e81a35c21e320cdd463bfcc4bd0
Closes-Bug: #1515134

commit_message:
Clarify the behaviour for the "require" thread policy

This removes any ambiguity around the behaviour when the "require"
thread policy is specified.

The previous wording would have opened up the possibility of scheduling
on a host without hyperthreads enabled.

Change-Id: I5d624c37f882df897391531e5639d731fd4744d9

subject: Add a disabled by ports -> files healthcheck plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-23 00:23:17.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_middleware/tests/test_healthcheck.py', 'oslo_middleware/healthcheck/pluginbase.py', 'oslo_middleware/healthcheck/__init__.py', 'setup.cfg', 'oslo_middleware/healthcheck/disable_by_file.py'], 'message': 'Add a disabled by ports -> files healthcheck plugin

Since most openstack applications do not run on a single
port it is useful to be able to have a single healthcheck
plugin that can respond to requests for different ports with
different files; this way for example keystone admin port can
be disabled while its public port can be kept active (without

Change-Id: I0bafb5a2091e54c9f01f24812438296b75afaf63
'}]
commit_message:
Add a disabled by ports -> files healthcheck plugin

Since most openstack applications do not run on a single
port it is useful to be able to have a single healthcheck
plugin that can respond to requests for different ports with
different files; this way for example keystone admin port can
be disabled while its public port can be kept active (without
having to run two different applications, one for the admin
endpoint and one for the public endpoint).

Change-Id: I0bafb5a2091e54c9f01f24812438296b75afaf63

subject: Selectively prune /root for ironic-agent ramdisk
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-26 02:29:01.000000000', 'files': ['elements/ironic-agent/cleanup.d/99-ramdisk-create'], 'message': 'Selectively prune /root for ironic-agent ramdisk

Previously all files in /root were ignored when building the
ironic-agent ramdisk. This prevented for example to use the
local-config element to connect to the ramdisk via ssh as root user.

This commit change the exclude rule on /root to only ignore the
/root/.cache directory.

Change-Id: I18d839e8d97636f5f2164ba407f252407d9bc956
Closes-Bug: #1451668
'}]
commit_message:
Selectively prune /root for ironic-agent ramdisk

Previously all files in /root were ignored when building the
ironic-agent ramdisk. This prevented for example to use the
local-config element to connect to the ramdisk via ssh as root user.

This commit change the exclude rule on /root to only ignore the
/root/.cache directory.

Change-Id: I18d839e8d97636f5f2164ba407f252407d9bc956
Closes-Bug: #1451668

commit_message:
Decouple transport for RPC and Notification

Add a new configuration option for setting up
an alternate notification_transport_url that
can be used for notifications. This allows
operators to separate the transport mechanisms
used for RPC and Notifications.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1504622
Change-Id: Ief6f95ea906bfd95b3218a930c9db5d8a764beb9

other things in the middleware.core directory. Move it out to its own
file before starting to refactor.

commit_message:
Deprecate Extensible Resource Tracker

We agreed at the Summit to remove the ERT. Before doing that, we need to
advertise the entrypoint consumers that they need to consider an alternative.

Release Notes should announce that too.

Co-Authored-By: Paul Murray <pmurray@hpe.com>

UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: Ie4b6670a828d99aebfd348bd700f9f58b3e39fdb

subject: Set ZUUL_BRANCH using BRANCH if not available
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-10 16:54:27.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh'], 'message': 'Set ZUUL_BRANCH using BRANCH if not available

In most cases, ZUUL_BRANCH is set in gate, but not all the time. One
exception is e.g. periodic stable jobs, where there is no actual patch
to validate, hence no ZUUL_REF or ZUUL_BRANCH is set. In that case, we
need to help zuul-cloner to determine the proper branch to fetch
neutron.

It could be achieved by e.g. hardcoding the branch using --zuul_branch
CLI argument passed into zuul-cloner. In this patch, I instead set
ZUUL_BRANCH to BRANCH that seems to be always present in all kinds of
jobs. It is then used by zuul-cloner to choose the correct branch.

This will be needed in the future when we spin out stable/mitaka and run
stable periodic jobs for neutron-fwaas.

Change-Id: I360239a1443f8d4e16210a1ef743912e1bf85f41
'}]
commit_message:
Set ZUUL_BRANCH using BRANCH if not available

In most cases, ZUUL_BRANCH is set in gate, but not all the time. One
exception is e.g. periodic stable jobs, where there is no actual patch
to validate, hence no ZUUL_REF or ZUUL_BRANCH is set. In that case, we
need to help zuul-cloner to determine the proper branch to fetch
neutron.

It could be achieved by e.g. hardcoding the branch using --zuul_branch
CLI argument passed into zuul-cloner. In this patch, I instead set
ZUUL_BRANCH to BRANCH that seems to be always present in all kinds of
jobs. It is then used by zuul-cloner to choose the correct branch.

This will be needed in the future when we spin out stable/mitaka and run
stable periodic jobs for neutron-fwaas.

Change-Id: I360239a1443f8d4e16210a1ef743912e1bf85f41

subject: Copy the env to the backup stack in failed update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-12 16:38:37.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': "Copy the env to the backup stack in failed update

When an update fails, we currently update the environment of the stack
to contain both the new and old parameters and types. Unfortunately we
don't do that for the backup stack which is reused. This patch adds the
environment change.

Change-Id: I4dc5dd35e4aeee498dd8960a1000913e97b924d5
Closes-Bug: 1508096
"}]
commit_message:
Copy the env to the backup stack in failed update

When an update fails, we currently update the environment of the stack
to contain both the new and old parameters and types. Unfortunately we
don't do that for the backup stack which is reused. This patch adds the
environment change.

Change-Id: I4dc5dd35e4aeee498dd8960a1000913e97b924d5
Closes-Bug: 1508096

upper bound to < 3.0.0

fixed in the patch that this depends on.

commit_message:
Configure collector to only record meter or event

Added the configuration options to allow the administrator to configure
the collector to only record meter or event by setting the
meter_dispatchers and event_dispatchers configuration.

Separated dispatcher managers load the dispatchers from different
namespaces for meter/event respectively.

Doc-Impact: separated meter/event dispatchers

Change-Id: I161318f4503ce79205b54a93f2ae9b4e052f7971
Closes-Bug: #1480333

commit_message:
Add a tool that can extract author information for oslo projects

This script will download the oslo repositories and then create
a per project html report with authorship information about each
project (which can then be viewed in your favorite web browser).

This will be used to see who could be a new oslo core recruit(s)
as core reviewers, or just as general useful things to know...

Change-Id: I780e39e353b06cadc1023bafe165b398e3f5a5d4

subject: Fix grub-efi-amd64-signed install failure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-12 07:23:57.000000000', 'files': ['elements/grub2/install.d/02-grub-install-spec', 'elements/grub2/pkg-map'], 'message': 'Fix grub-efi-amd64-signed install failure

When build ubuntu iso image, it will install grub-efi-amd64-signed
and grub-efi-amd64 packages. Both of the postinst script will try
to find root device and install grub which will definitely fail in
such a chroot environment.
So the workaround is to skip error and remove postinst script.

Fixed bug #1491280

Change-Id: I2b2d0686e2f8ab8c88222f3dc777c607be4d84a4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix grub-efi-amd64-signed install failure

When build ubuntu iso image, it will install grub-efi-amd64-signed
and grub-efi-amd64 packages. Both of the postinst script will try
to find root device and install grub which will definitely fail in
such a chroot environment.
So the workaround is to skip error and remove postinst script.

Fixed bug #1491280

Change-Id: I2b2d0686e2f8ab8c88222f3dc777c607be4d84a4

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-13 00:18:31.000000000', 'files': ['cue/tests/functional/utils.py', 'cue/api/controllers/v1/cluster.py'], 'message': 'py3: Replace unicode with six.text_type

* Replace unicode with six.text_type
* Replace (str, unicode) with six.string_types

This change makes modified code compatible with Python 3.

Move also imports in cue/api/controllers/v1/cluster.py to respect the
OpenStack coding style on imports.

The initial patch was generated by the unicode operation of the sixer
tool.

Change-Id: Ib53087f74d52fe60381e8cca2f0209d39f09e24d
'}]
commit_message:
py3: Replace unicode with six.text_type

* Replace unicode with six.text_type
* Replace (str, unicode) with six.string_types

This change makes modified code compatible with Python 3.

Move also imports in cue/api/controllers/v1/cluster.py to respect the
OpenStack coding style on imports.

The initial patch was generated by the unicode operation of the sixer
tool.

Change-Id: Ib53087f74d52fe60381e8cca2f0209d39f09e24d

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-11-12 11:04:16.000000000', 'files': ['rally/exceptions.py', 'rally/verification/tempest/config.py'], 'message': '[Verify] Don't mask original exc if failure happens

We shouldn't mask the original exception and traceback
if any failure happens when we create a Tempest resource.
So this patch is intended to fix the issue. Also exception
"TempestResourceCreationFailure" was removed from exceptions.py
because this one is not used anywhere now.

Change-Id: I3edbefb11430f4bf5279efbd89ccc297f2fb84db
'}]
commit_message:
[Verify] Don't mask original exc if failure happens

We shouldn't mask the original exception and traceback
if any failure happens when we create a Tempest resource.
So this patch is intended to fix the issue. Also exception
"TempestResourceCreationFailure" was removed from exceptions.py
because this one is not used anywhere now.

Change-Id: I3edbefb11430f4bf5279efbd89ccc297f2fb84db

resource to check if it is valid.

iteration was just one too many.

* vzstorage: replace a/b with a//b to use integer division on
  Python 3.
* fix os.path.exists mock: only override return for path /fake
  (shares config)
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_vzstorage

Note: remove also spaces in parameters in two functions calls to

Change-Id: I7cee7009d8bc87cd0294e90cb2967f4560276994
'}]
commit_message:
Port vzstorage to Python 3

* vzstorage: replace a/b with a//b to use integer division on
  Python 3.
* fix os.path.exists mock: only override return for path /fake
  (shares config)
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_vzstorage

Note: remove also spaces in parameters in two functions calls to
respect the PEP 8.

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I7cee7009d8bc87cd0294e90cb2967f4560276994

subject: Swarm: Add TimeoutStartSec=300 to docker service
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 668, 'name': 'Adrian Otto', 'email': 'aotto@aotto.com', 'username': 'aotto'}, {'_account_id': 7049, 'name': 'Kai Qiang Wu(Kennan)', 'email': 'wkq5325@gmail.com', 'username': 'Kennan'}, {'_account_id': 8143, 'name': 'Egor Guz', 'email': 'egor.guz@gmail.com', 'username': 'eghobo'}, {'_account_id': 10263, 'name': 'Vilobh Meshram', 'email': 'vilobhmm@yahoo-inc.com', 'username': 'vilobhmm'}, {'_account_id': 11536, 'name': 'hongbin', 'email': 'hongbin034@gmail.com', 'username': 'hongbin'}, {'_account_id': 12175, 'name': 'Eli Qiao', 'email': 'qiaoliyong@gmail.com', 'username': 'Eli'}, {'_account_id': 12385, 'name': 'Motohiro/Yuanying Otsuka', 'email': 'yuanying@fraction.jp', 'username': 'yuanying'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-12 07:13:08.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/templates/swarm/fragments/write-docker-service.sh'], 'message': "Swarm: Add TimeoutStartSec=300 to docker service

The default value of TimeoutStartSec=90, but it will fail on gate.
set TimeoutStartSec=300 to docker service.
It is hard to decide which one is the best choice, I tested on gate, 180 is
fine, some other guys tested on their local setup, said 4 mins, let's
hard code it as 300s first, if docker failed to start at 5 mins, it would be
failed.

see link [1] for reference.
[1] http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man5/systemd.service.5.html

Co-Authored-By: Kai Qiang Wu <wkqwu@cn.ibm.com>
Partially implements: blueprint swarm-functional-testing
Change-Id: I4fe4f607a2353010092ff565a7189ad3189b0ea9
"}]
commit_message:
Swarm: Add TimeoutStartSec=300 to docker service

The default value of TimeoutStartSec=90, but it will fail on gate.
set TimeoutStartSec=300 to docker service.
It is hard to decide which one is the best choice, I tested on gate, 180 is
fine, some other guys tested on their local setup, said 4 mins, let's
hard code it as 300s first, if docker failed to start at 5 mins, it would be
failed.

see link [1] for reference.
[1] http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man5/systemd.service.5.html

Co-Authored-By: Kai Qiang Wu <wkqwu@cn.ibm.com>
Partially implements: blueprint swarm-functional-testing
Change-Id: I4fe4f607a2353010092ff565a7189ad3189b0ea9

commit_message:
Use olso.log directly

As the openstack/common is deprecated, Watcher should use oslo lib
directly to run in the openstack env. So there is much work to do
with oslo. This patch fixed the log part.

Change-Id: I3145a842fe3a22b3d08fec60d180329073edd50f

subject: Removing translation to work with Django 1.7.x
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-12 21:53:05.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt', 'cuedashboard/messagebroker/tabs.py', '_70_cue_panel_group.py', 'cuedashboard/messagebroker/workflows.py', 'cuedashboard/tests/settings.py', 'setup.cfg', 'cuedashboard/messagebroker/panel.py', 'cuedashboard/messagebroker/tables.py', 'cuedashboard/messagebroker/views.py'], 'message': 'Removing translation to work with Django 1.7.x

Django 1.7.x changed such that trying to use any of the translation
functions prior to instantiating the wsgi app results in failures.

Removing all translation until it can be handled properly with
Django 1.7.x or greater.

Change-Id: I0725e64001a8ae877e6e1422d5aa8ca81e2d1aa4
'}]
commit_message:
Removing translation to work with Django 1.7.x

Django 1.7.x changed such that trying to use any of the translation
functions prior to instantiating the wsgi app results in failures.

Removing all translation until it can be handled properly with
Django 1.7.x or greater.

Change-Id: I0725e64001a8ae877e6e1422d5aa8ca81e2d1aa4

commit_message:
Added gathering cron.log from nodes

Added gathering file /var/log/cron.log from the nodes.
The file uses in diagnostic snapshots.

Change-Id: I9d1ef14e2752d0a8433981b8070ab9f47e6e8a7e
Closes-Bug: #1498437

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-10-30 22:45:23.000000000', 'files': ['etc/cinder/api-paste.ini'], 'message': 'Adds CORS support to Cinder

This patch adds the CORS support middleware to Cinder, allowing a
deployer to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client
may break the single-origin policy and access the API directly.

For cinder, the paste.ini method of deploying the middleware was
chosen, because it needs to be able to annotate responses created
by keystonemiddleware. If the middleware was explicitly included,
keystone would reject the request before the cross-domain headers
could be annotated, resulting in an error response that is
unreadable by the user agent.

Note that tests were explicitly not included. Cinder does not
possess a functional test suite, and thus constructing any
fake application with the CORS Middleware would not correctly
test the paste.ini initialization code path.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ifac1f2c56365089a36091dc2e38d4641c135ea34
'}]
commit_message:
Adds CORS support to Cinder

This patch adds the CORS support middleware to Cinder, allowing a
deployer to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client
may break the single-origin policy and access the API directly.

For cinder, the paste.ini method of deploying the middleware was
chosen, because it needs to be able to annotate responses created
by keystonemiddleware. If the middleware was explicitly included,
keystone would reject the request before the cross-domain headers
could be annotated, resulting in an error response that is
unreadable by the user agent.

Note that tests were explicitly not included. Cinder does not
possess a functional test suite, and thus constructing any
fake application with the CORS Middleware would not correctly
test the paste.ini initialization code path.

OpenStack CrossProject Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ifac1f2c56365089a36091dc2e38d4641c135ea34

commit_message:
Use assertFalse instead of assertEqual

As the changes have been made for use of assertFalse over assertEqual
for matching false. This patch will do the same change in some
statements which were not covered by previous patches.

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-11 16:22:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_shelve.py'], 'message': "Fix impotent _poll_shelved_instances tests

Almost all of our unit tests for the _poll_shelved_intances() periodic
task were not actually running any code because they didn't set the config
properly. Some were also not setting the instance host either, which means
the test instances wouldn't be returned from the filter query. Since the
tests used stubs and mox, they weren't checking that the stubbed methods
were actually running and thus didn't notice.

This patch makes them use mock, check their work, and set the config
properly. It also does a little object and mock cleanup for the bits that
were touched.

Change-Id: If890eb61e42af3e1495da7db9033b19fa7811aa1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix impotent _poll_shelved_instances tests

Almost all of our unit tests for the _poll_shelved_intances() periodic
task were not actually running any code because they didn't set the config
properly. Some were also not setting the instance host either, which means
the test instances wouldn't be returned from the filter query. Since the
tests used stubs and mox, they weren't checking that the stubbed methods
were actually running and thus didn't notice.

This patch makes them use mock, check their work, and set the config
properly. It also does a little object and mock cleanup for the bits that
were touched.

Change-Id: If890eb61e42af3e1495da7db9033b19fa7811aa1

subject: FWaaS: Add explicit arguments to update commands
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-14 18:06:41.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/fw/firewall.py', 'neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/fw/firewallpolicy.py', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/fw/test_cli20_firewall.py', 'neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/fw/firewallrule.py', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/fw/test_cli20_firewallpolicy.py', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/fw/test_cli20_firewallrule.py'], 'message': "FWaaS: Add explicit arguments to update commands

The firewall CLI relied on implicit arguments during update for
values like name, description, admin_state_up.  They worked due
to extra values parsing but were not documented in the help.

Added explicit parser arguments for values that work on the
REST resource boundary to enable help documentation and clearer
control.  This impacts firewall, firewallpolicy and firewallrule
resources.

For admin_state_up, ensured the various forms work:
Not passed, argument suppressed so update doesn't cause change
and create still defaults to up.
'--admin_state_up', with no extra parameter - defaults to True
'--admin_state_up=True', '--admin_state_up True', '--admin_state_up 1'
forms continue to work.

For shared flag, also enabled various forms to allow update means
to change a rule/policy from 'shared true' to 'shared false' via
'--shared=False'.

Added common argument parsing for firewall rules between create
and update due to number of arguments.

Change-Id: Ifbd2a42f0cf574cbd7405df51181d95538a7edcb
Closes-Bug: #1503642
"}]
commit_message:
FWaaS: Add explicit arguments to update commands

The firewall CLI relied on implicit arguments during update for
values like name, description, admin_state_up.  They worked due
to extra values parsing but were not documented in the help.

Added explicit parser arguments for values that work on the
REST resource boundary to enable help documentation and clearer
control.  This impacts firewall, firewallpolicy and firewallrule
resources.

For admin_state_up, ensured the various forms work:
Not passed, argument suppressed so update doesn't cause change
and create still defaults to up.
'--admin_state_up', with no extra parameter - defaults to True
'--admin_state_up=True', '--admin_state_up True', '--admin_state_up 1'
forms continue to work.

For shared flag, also enabled various forms to allow update means
to change a rule/policy from 'shared true' to 'shared false' via
'--shared=False'.

Added common argument parsing for firewall rules between create
and update due to number of arguments.

Change-Id: Ifbd2a42f0cf574cbd7405df51181d95538a7edcb
Closes-Bug: #1503642

subject: set min_compute_nodes when running in multinode mode
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-12 00:08:26.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh', 'functions.sh'], 'message': "set min_compute_nodes when running in multinode mode

To ensure that our multinode configurations actually have multiple
working workers, we're building some tests in Tempest that attempt to
land on every node by using scheduler hints (force_hosts). This
requires that we set the minimum number of nodes that are expected to
be found in a configuration (it defaults to 1).

Change-Id: I59ca8b76dc3fe0c62236de11dbf44d52fa37226a
Depends-On: I7d7230d100901179a1d1a0281aa8be990d00c02a
"}]
commit_message:
set min_compute_nodes when running in multinode mode

To ensure that our multinode configurations actually have multiple
working workers, we're building some tests in Tempest that attempt to
land on every node by using scheduler hints (force_hosts). This
requires that we set the minimum number of nodes that are expected to
be found in a configuration (it defaults to 1).

Change-Id: I59ca8b76dc3fe0c62236de11dbf44d52fa37226a
Depends-On: I7d7230d100901179a1d1a0281aa8be990d00c02a

subject: Update template paths for environment-mapped TemplateResources
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-11 23:37:07.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/template_resource.py'], 'message': "Update template paths for environment-mapped TemplateResources

When updating a template resource, we weren't taking into account the
possibility that the new environment could be mapping the resource to a
different template path. This change ensures we recalculate the template
name from the new environment before reloading the template during an
update.

Change-Id: I5f84f6fd60925d3dba0b8e8dec867657c8c5c9ef
Closes-Bug: #1452534
(cherry picked from commit 686f317ccae280bd8b536379e89ba743746ae159)
"}]
commit_message:
Update template paths for environment-mapped TemplateResources

When updating a template resource, we weren't taking into account the
possibility that the new environment could be mapping the resource to a
different template path. This change ensures we recalculate the template
name from the new environment before reloading the template during an
update.

Change-Id: I5f84f6fd60925d3dba0b8e8dec867657c8c5c9ef
Closes-Bug: #1452534
(cherry picked from commit 686f317ccae280bd8b536379e89ba743746ae159)

commit_message:
Guestagent configuration tests mock chown/chmod

Avoid executing chmod and chown OS calls in configuration manager tests
as they may cause failures on various platforms.
Do not assert the mocked calls as testing them is not intent here.

Change-Id: Ib858c74a4ec09d13b34858290ae7f38864a998b0
Closes-Bug: 1515328

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-10 01:28:30.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_stack_resource.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': 'Tolerate missing template resource type

If a template resource type is added during a stack-update, the update
will fail because the old environment is used on some code paths until
the update completes.

This change falls back to TemplateResource if a ResourceTypeNotFound is
raised. Previously this only happened when TemplateNotFound is raised.

Change-Id: Id040c8f7ab1231056c67cf363bf26168a5684340
Closes-Bug: #1508096
'}]
commit_message:
Tolerate missing template resource type

If a template resource type is added during a stack-update, the update
will fail because the old environment is used on some code paths until
the update completes.

This change falls back to TemplateResource if a ResourceTypeNotFound is
raised. Previously this only happened when TemplateNotFound is raised.

Change-Id: Id040c8f7ab1231056c67cf363bf26168a5684340
Closes-Bug: #1508096

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-11 16:22:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_shelve.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Fix race in _poll_shelved_instances task

The _poll_shelved_instances() task can race with other API operations
because it does not filter instances with a task_state!=None, and because
it does not use expected_task_state=(None,) when it attempts to lock the
instance for offloading. This patch adds those checks as well as tests to
make sure they're honored going forward.

Change-Id: I7b1e235a4d09085cebf3d6d71d71757f15f69e29
"}]
commit_message:
Fix race in _poll_shelved_instances task

The _poll_shelved_instances() task can race with other API operations
because it does not filter instances with a task_state!=None, and because
it does not use expected_task_state=(None,) when it attempts to lock the
instance for offloading. This patch adds those checks as well as tests to
make sure they're honored going forward.

Change-Id: I7b1e235a4d09085cebf3d6d71d71757f15f69e29

validate non-ascii values for swift properties

skip properties that are non-ascii values, but proceed
with properties that work. log these failed values back
to the user.

Closes-Bug: 1503898

commit_message:
Fix failure of unit test TestCinderAllCmd

After introducing the commit 93d26e40098c966e7d791a9fb6152244a9f9409d
unit test TestCinderAllCmd fails if a test environment has
/etc/cinder/cinder.conf with proper backend configuration.
We should mock out some variables not to depend on test environment.

(cherry picked from commit c10beb9fc0105d570ce87e4adb242b4393054862)

commit_message:
[WIP] Support for Glance v2

This is extremely WIPy and not ready for consumption. Only a basic
read-only wrapper is implemented for now. V1 should still work as
usual, v2 should work as read-only. Metadata/properties stuff with v2
entirely tbd.

Remaining TODOs:
- Fix failing tests / panel registration issue
- Properly use the APIVersionManager
- Stop hardcoding versions in glance.py
- Create / Update [ without messing the properties ]
- Unit tests for v1 and v2, test_data for both versions
- *A LOT* of work with properties, custom properties
- Also: handle case when custom properties are disabled

Implements blueprint: horizon-glance-v2
Co-Authored-By: Travis Tripp <travis.tripp@hp.com>

Change-Id: If4103df2b1a3860baf3dc15d424f9a6b352166c0

commit_message:
Enable space-in-parens

This rule will enforce consistency of spacing directly inside of
parentheses, by disallowing or requiring one or more spaces to
the right of ( and to the left of ). In either case, () will still
be allowed.

Change-Id: I83edef0598f82c2b34fd3a4d7262b6ea9204d2b3

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2874, 'name': 'yong sheng gong', 'email': 'gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net', 'username': 'gongysh'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 11343, 'name': 'Gal Sagie', 'email': 'gal.sagie@gmail.com', 'username': 'GalSagie'}, {'_account_id': 11762, 'name': 'Han Zhou', 'email': 'zhouhan@gmail.com', 'username': 'hanzhou'}, {'_account_id': 12860, 'name': 'Dongcan Ye', 'email': 'yedongcan@yeah.net', 'username': 'yedongcan'}, {'_account_id': 17595, 'name': 'Amitabha Biswas', 'email': 'azbiswas@gmail.com', 'username': 'azbiswas'}, {'_account_id': 18589, 'name': 'Chandra Sekhar Vejendla', 'email': 'csvejend@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'chandrav'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-11-12 20:58:15.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovn_api.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/common/config.py', 'devstack/local.conf.sample', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/commands.py', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'networking_ovn/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Add/delete router interfaces

This patch set adds support for add/delete router interfaces.
Adding router port involves:
    - Create row in logical_router_port table
    - Update the ports in logical_router table with the
    logical_router_port added above
    - Update the options column in logical_port table with
    {router-port: "UUID of logical_router_port"}
    - set the type column in the logical_port table to "router"

Deleting router ports:
    - Look for port_id if port_id not present in incoming request
    - Delete the router port from the logical_router table
    The logical_router_port entry will be garbage collected

Added a config variable OVN_L3_MODE which when set to false,
will default to using q-l3 instead of OVN L3. This is a temporary fix
until we resolve OVN l3 issues.

Closes-Bug: #1514649
Change-Id: I6fd9ac4ab04be14796422087d3ff716cd4d81e55
Co-Authored-By: Gal Sagie <gal.sagie@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Amitabha Biswas <abiswas@us.ibm.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add/delete router interfaces

This patch set adds support for add/delete router interfaces.
Adding router port involves:
    - Create row in logical_router_port table
    - Update the ports in logical_router table with the
    logical_router_port added above
    - Update the options column in logical_port table with
    {router-port: "UUID of logical_router_port"}
    - set the type column in the logical_port table to "router"

Deleting router ports:
    - Look for port_id if port_id not present in incoming request
    - Delete the router port from the logical_router table
    The logical_router_port entry will be garbage collected

Added a config variable OVN_L3_MODE which when set to false,
will default to using q-l3 instead of OVN L3. This is a temporary fix
until we resolve OVN l3 issues.

Closes-Bug: #1514649
Change-Id: I6fd9ac4ab04be14796422087d3ff716cd4d81e55
Co-Authored-By: Gal Sagie <gal.sagie@huawei.com>
Co-Authored-By: Amitabha Biswas <abiswas@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Add retries to TestRail client

In order to workaround API limitations (such as
requests rate), adding mechanism of requests
retries based on predefined error codes.

Try to resend request 3 times if '429' code is
received from API.

Closes-bug: #1514797
Change-Id: I723ef7886c86b7e418627962a1ff8aa7a4281c0a

Follow up for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/236007

This fixes following minor items:

- Fix a 'raise Exception class' syntax to 'raise Exception instance'
- Use original eventlet.Timeout instead of swift.exceptions.Timeout
  imported from eventlet.Timeout

commit_message:
Small cleanup for unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj

Follow up for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/236007

This fixes following minor items:

- Fix a 'raise Exception class' syntax to 'raise Exception instance'
- Use original eventlet.Timeout instead of swift.exceptions.Timeout
  imported from eventlet.Timeout
- Change Timeout to initiate w/o args (1st arguments should be timeout
  second and we don't have to set None if we don't want to set the sec)
- Add a message argument to some Exception instances

Change-Id: Iab608cd8a1f4d3f5b4963c26b94ab0501837ffe1

subject: Make "Connect(ing|ed) to AMQP server" log messages DEBUG level
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-12 04:47:10.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_rabbit.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': 'Make "Connect(ing|ed) to AMQP server" log messages DEBUG level

According to our guidelines, INFO level is for unit-of-work messages
valueable for an operator. This rules out "connecting" message.
As to "connected", while it might fall under guidelines, it seems
to flood logs without too much value, see for example:
http://logs.openstack.org/98/219298/9/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-pxe_ipa/53784fb/logs/screen-ir-api.txt.gz?level=INFO

Change-Id: I65e0f19590c42d25e5551d45af37416a01a7d638
'}]
commit_message:
Make "Connect(ing|ed) to AMQP server" log messages DEBUG level

According to our guidelines, INFO level is for unit-of-work messages
valueable for an operator. This rules out "connecting" message.
As to "connected", while it might fall under guidelines, it seems
to flood logs without too much value, see for example:
http://logs.openstack.org/98/219298/9/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-pxe_ipa/53784fb/logs/screen-ir-api.txt.gz?level=INFO

Change-Id: I65e0f19590c42d25e5551d45af37416a01a7d638

commit_message:
Remove TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR in the api tox env

Setting TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR in tox.ini is breaking the gate,
probably because of a tox bug [1].
Removing the line to unblock the gate. This implies that
for local execution of the tests TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR
should be set manually.

[1] https://bitbucket.org/hpk42/tox/issues/285/tox-220-breaks-some-toxini-config-files

Change-Id: If3742b6eabe295a5aaeb4901c55909a70c451698
Closes-bug: #1515335

commit_message:
Pin werkzeug to sub 0.11 for now

Werkzeug has trouble with reload (needed for cert rotation) and
SSL in the latest release 0.11.x - so pinning it to the last
"working" for now.

We expect this to be fixed in the next maintenance release of
werkzeug and hecne won't make that fix permanent.

Change-Id: Iacc1906ce3091322c8a1e9dbdf6392c77f3807b5
Closes-Bug: 1514644

subject: Fix grab console log partial gets
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-11 22:59:23.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/grab_console_log.sh'], 'message': 'Fix grab console log partial gets

The grab console log script started by cleaning out any existing console
log files with echo. Unfortunately echo appends a newline by default
which meant we ended up with a 1 byte file instead of a 0 byte file.
This resulted in grabbing the console log from byte offset 1 instead of
0 and jenkins is weird and prepended base64 content at the beginning of
the log file in this case.

Fix this by using echo -n to clear the file which results in a 0 byte
file.

Change-Id: I8bd7cbd0c19cd44067839b34e317248daad9f578
'}]
commit_message:
Fix grab console log partial gets

The grab console log script started by cleaning out any existing console
log files with echo. Unfortunately echo appends a newline by default
which meant we ended up with a 1 byte file instead of a 0 byte file.
This resulted in grabbing the console log from byte offset 1 instead of
0 and jenkins is weird and prepended base64 content at the beginning of
the log file in this case.

Fix this by using echo -n to clear the file which results in a 0 byte
file.

Change-Id: I8bd7cbd0c19cd44067839b34e317248daad9f578

commit_message:
Adds config to disable the password in stack

Currently a password is needed when doing a stack creation using
Horizon. This patch adds a configurable setting in local_settings.py
file, so that it can be disabled from the stack creation form.

Change-Id: I82783b73940e39d961ac70a5ce86abdaca02eba7
Closes-bug: #1290344
Co-Authored-By: Richard Jones <r1chardj0n3s@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jesse Keating <jlk@bluebox.net>

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Remove TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR in the api tox env""

This reverts commit 286f5d41dc255c711a3fcb0d978b63752deb2bbd.

The revert was merged too quickly, without waiting for tox project to fix us.
The gate passed for the revert only because infra folks removed images
that had new tox in them. We will be broken by the next images though.

subject: avoid unnecessary inner join in get_resources() for SQL backend
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-09 07:24:21.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': 'avoid unnecessary inner join in get_resources() for SQL backend

To get distinct resource ids, we do a query on resource table which
inner join sample table, and apply filters on it.

Note that when sql_expire_samples_only is enabled, there will be
some resources without any sample, in such case we must use inner
join to avoid wrong result, no matter if there is a timestamp filter
or not.

But that option is disabled by default, so when there is no timestamp
filters, the inner join is unnecessary, we should avoid it to save
some RAM/CPU cost.

Change-Id: If85dbea15d42d42c6b0be7402c06f258e278b2eb
Closes-Bug: #1509677
(cherry picked from commit a4f442940551a8a38e26e132c7efa766226daa15)
'}]
commit_message:
avoid unnecessary inner join in get_resources() for SQL backend

To get distinct resource ids, we do a query on resource table which
inner join sample table, and apply filters on it.

Note that when sql_expire_samples_only is enabled, there will be
some resources without any sample, in such case we must use inner
join to avoid wrong result, no matter if there is a timestamp filter
or not.

But that option is disabled by default, so when there is no timestamp
filters, the inner join is unnecessary, we should avoid it to save
some RAM/CPU cost.

Change-Id: If85dbea15d42d42c6b0be7402c06f258e278b2eb
Closes-Bug: #1509677
(cherry picked from commit a4f442940551a8a38e26e132c7efa766226daa15)

subject: avoid generate temporary table when query samples
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-26 13:26:57.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py', 'ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': 'avoid generate temporary table when query samples

Currently, when we call query-samples API, for SQL backend, we do
an inner join to get a temporary table, then apply filters, orderby
and limit options on it. Such implementation will drain disk space
or cause timeout exception when data set is growing, even with specified
limit and filters.

This patch applies filters and limit on the inner join itself, and
uses a fake mapper object instead of temporary table to suit current
query transformer.

Change-Id: I261a2dd362ed51c16a6fa191dadcce1b45fce2e4
Closes-Bug: #1506738
(cherry picked from commit b9bf5f1f571f21aee4347c80a5a7ac8a1c456e45)
'}]
commit_message:
avoid generate temporary table when query samples

Currently, when we call query-samples API, for SQL backend, we do
an inner join to get a temporary table, then apply filters, orderby
and limit options on it. Such implementation will drain disk space
or cause timeout exception when data set is growing, even with specified
limit and filters.

This patch applies filters and limit on the inner join itself, and
uses a fake mapper object instead of temporary table to suit current
query transformer.

Change-Id: I261a2dd362ed51c16a6fa191dadcce1b45fce2e4
Closes-Bug: #1506738
(cherry picked from commit b9bf5f1f571f21aee4347c80a5a7ac8a1c456e45)

commit_message:
Demo patch for ironic panel index page

Steps:
- Login as admin, you should see `Ironic` in Admin dashboard
  > Systems panel group
- Click on it, you should see a page with `Nodes` as page title
  and a table listing the nodes in the current region. You should be
  able to:

  - setect nodes;
  - power on/off slected nodes;
  - put selected nodes to maintenance mode, or remove them from
    maintenance mode.

Change-Id: I0a15c2985578c03ca9ac43e4a42596f1c301f161

commit_message:
Creating Ironic APIs

This patch implements Ironic APIs at all layers

- Client-side angular Ironic API service.
- Server-side rest Ironic API for Ajax.
- Server-side Ironic API using Python ironic client.

APIs include:

- Retrieve a list of nodes.
- Retrieve details for a node.
- List all the ports with a given node.
- Set power state on/off for a given node.
- Set maintenance mode state on/off for a given node.

Change-Id: I759114186359d41c65bb9713ac6a86c6860ed923
Partially-Implements: blueprint ng-admin-ironic-panel

commit_message:
Creating admin ironic panel

This patch adds an empty ironic panel to admin dashboard, which
is a part of implementation for a fully working ironic panel.
When the implementation completed, it will provide these features 
to Horizon:

As an admin, I can:

* get a list of all the nodes in a given region.
* check and modify power state for a node.
* check and modify maintenance state for a node.
* check all other detailed information of a given node.

The implementation is angular-based.

Testing: a demo patch is provided for testing.

Change-Id: I515f3b348bee09b1f6b4602dfb5ce48a465d41bd
Partially-Implements: blueprint ng-admin-ironic-panel

subject: Revert "Add magnum support to functional tests on shade"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-12 20:13:23.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/shade.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "Add magnum support to functional tests on shade"

The magnum devstack plugin does not conform to our expectations of
how a project should interact with our CI system.  It downloads
an opaque image from a fedorapeople hosted site.

Instead, it should build an image using our CI system, host it
on tarballs.o.o, and, assuming it is not too large, be cached by
our image builds.

Until it does that, we should not use it in other projects.

This reverts commit 9cf8601417c74714fd7e56ee68ff4723f5933731.

Change-Id: I9c887ceb2585fb092dce3e400758b6dc9f32acde
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add magnum support to functional tests on shade"

The magnum devstack plugin does not conform to our expectations of
how a project should interact with our CI system.  It downloads
an opaque image from a fedorapeople hosted site.

Instead, it should build an image using our CI system, host it
on tarballs.o.o, and, assuming it is not too large, be cached by
our image builds.

Until it does that, we should not use it in other projects.

This reverts commit 9cf8601417c74714fd7e56ee68ff4723f5933731.

Change-Id: I9c887ceb2585fb092dce3e400758b6dc9f32acde

commit_message:
Enable metadata when create server groups

instance_group object already support instance group metadata but
heat resource do not support this.
This patch was enabling metadata support when creating instance
group as heat resource.

commit_message:
Add common config options to san

This patch copies three config options from storwize_svc driver
to the base san driver in order to minimize duplicating
of config options within the storwize_svc driver.
This accommodates removing of the aforementioned config options
in the future as a part of our refactoring process.

This patch is part of a series of patches with the aim of
bringing the storwize_svc driver in line with other san based
Cinder drivers.

Co-Authored By: Jacob Gregor <jgregor@us.ibm.com>

Partially implements: blueprint refactor-storwize-driver-for-mitaka

Change-Id: If2361a706e10725e343efc0993523f6c9059fe34

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-28 16:53:45.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/eseries/library.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/eseries/client.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/eseries/test_library.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/eseries/fakes.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/eseries/test_client.py'], 'message': 'NetApp: Fix issue with E-Series volume expand

The volume extend operation is using the wrong backend
API to expand the volume capacity. A volume copy is being
used to achieve the expansion for performance reasons,
but this results in snapshots defined on the original
volume being lost.

This patch updates the volume extend API to use the correct
method for expanding the volume capacity. For a thin-provisioned
volume or a volume defined on a DDP, this operation is very fast.
However, for a standard volume-group, this method will block
until the expansion has completed, because the expansion capacity
will not be available until completion.

Closes-Bug: 1506212
Change-Id: I1cb91b96ede732a76204287043b63a2a67f805f4
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp: Fix issue with E-Series volume expand

The volume extend operation is using the wrong backend
API to expand the volume capacity. A volume copy is being
used to achieve the expansion for performance reasons,
but this results in snapshots defined on the original
volume being lost.

This patch updates the volume extend API to use the correct
method for expanding the volume capacity. For a thin-provisioned
volume or a volume defined on a DDP, this operation is very fast.
However, for a standard volume-group, this method will block
until the expansion has completed, because the expansion capacity
will not be available until completion.

Closes-Bug: 1506212
Change-Id: I1cb91b96ede732a76204287043b63a2a67f805f4

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-10-15 17:33:43.000000000', 'files': ['security-notes/OSSN-0059'], 'message': 'Adding an OSSN for bug 1456228 - Trusted VM powered on untrusted host

OpenStack Trusted Computing Pools does not call remote Attestation API to
check whether the host is trust or not when a trusted VM is powered
on. This makes it possible to power on a trusted VM on an untrusted host.

Closes-Bug #1456228

Change-Id: Id81df58cdaa9dd58d885f0b6c4b98e46a2e305ba
'}]
commit_message:
Adding an OSSN for bug 1456228 - Trusted VM powered on untrusted host

OpenStack Trusted Computing Pools does not call remote Attestation API to
check whether the host is trust or not when a trusted VM is powered
on. This makes it possible to power on a trusted VM on an untrusted host.

Closes-Bug #1456228

Change-Id: Id81df58cdaa9dd58d885f0b6c4b98e46a2e305ba

Changes since 2.34.0:

e9268e9 Functional tests for os-extended-server-attributes
5f5ec35 Add v2 support for optional project_id in version discovery urls
c6a3c76 Check flavor option before image checks
4f16fe6 make project_id optional in urls for version discovery

'}]
commit_message:
mitaka: release python-novaclient 2.35.0

We want to do this minor release to get some things flushed out before
we start tackling backwards incompatible changes that will trigger a
major version bump to 3.0, like removing the novaclient.v1_1 module.

Changes since 2.34.0:

e9268e9 Functional tests for os-extended-server-attributes
5f5ec35 Add v2 support for optional project_id in version discovery urls
c6a3c76 Check flavor option before image checks
4f16fe6 make project_id optional in urls for version discovery
09bb834 Refactor parsing metadata to a common function

The upper-constraints change is:

I07d33438cd5f13c5c16498b4b275eead7bac244b

Change-Id: I4552b113efd8087ac942405c3c75e12da0f26d71

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-12 12:56:12.000000000', 'files': ['bandit/bandit.py', 'bandit/core/test_properties.py'], 'message': 'Changing the way baseline formatters are indicated

This commit adds a decorator for formatters to use to indicate
that they are able to display baseline results.  A formatter
should add @accepts_baseline before the report function to show
that it is capable of displaying candidate results.

Change-Id: I5532d4b322b7df9dbca8a2275bf6e273d2801a3a
'}]
commit_message:
Changing the way baseline formatters are indicated

This commit adds a decorator for formatters to use to indicate
that they are able to display baseline results.  A formatter
should add @accepts_baseline before the report function to show
that it is capable of displaying candidate results.

Change-Id: I5532d4b322b7df9dbca8a2275bf6e273d2801a3a

subject: Ironic: Explicitly allow DHCP ports
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-06 20:40:43.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ironic'], 'message': "Ironic: Explicitly allow DHCP ports

This adds an iptables rule to allow ports 67 and 68. We see
occassionally dropped DHCP packets, which may be causing PXE failures in
ironic jobs.

I'm not 100% confident this fixes the issue, however I don't think it
can break anything and it rules out one theory.

Change-Id: I4630afb6f010a4c2cb146a79264c480c64c6e4b7
Related-Bug: #1393099
"}]
commit_message:
Ironic: Explicitly allow DHCP ports

This adds an iptables rule to allow ports 67 and 68. We see
occassionally dropped DHCP packets, which may be causing PXE failures in
ironic jobs.

I'm not 100% confident this fixes the issue, however I don't think it
can break anything and it rules out one theory.

Change-Id: I4630afb6f010a4c2cb146a79264c480c64c6e4b7
Related-Bug: #1393099

commit_message:
Use kilo RDO repository

Use kilo RDO repository on kilo branch.

Note we slightly change the check here to just accept any
pre-installed RDO; devstack-gate might have installed the latest for
us, because it needs openvswitch to setup multi-node testing, which is
just about the only thing we use from RDO.

Change-Id: I42b8bc1aea8ff61770987eecd5fc3b8309c1e210

commit_message:
Do not remove python-pip package on Fedora-23

python on fedora 23 compiled with rewheel support,
in this case the python-pip is a required package, and cannot be
removed.

[1] http://pkgs.fedoraproject.org/cgit/python.git/tree/python.spec?id=3b6fac0339bab69ca5fbf2881568f0565ab0e252#n174

Change-Id: I499b7bec97c4360b32d156079f2b7f3923e3888a

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-11-09 22:10:35.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/replace_is_default_with_is_protected.rst'], 'message': "Modify 'is_default' behavior relative to 'is_protected' for templates

With the addition of the general *is_protected* field on all objects,
the *is_default* field on cluster and node group templates is semi-redundant.
Its semantics should be changed; specifically, gating of update and
delete operations should be handled exclusively by *is_protected*. The
*is_default* field should still be used to identify default templates for bulk
update and delete operations by the sahara-templates tool.

Partial-implements: blueprint replace-is-default
Change-Id: I9808df9546636d755fc9c999ebee45e1ec9f2b1a
"}]
commit_message:
Modify 'is_default' behavior relative to 'is_protected' for templates

With the addition of the general *is_protected* field on all objects,
the *is_default* field on cluster and node group templates is semi-redundant.
Its semantics should be changed; specifically, gating of update and
delete operations should be handled exclusively by *is_protected*. The
*is_default* field should still be used to identify default templates for bulk
update and delete operations by the sahara-templates tool.

Partial-implements: blueprint replace-is-default
Change-Id: I9808df9546636d755fc9c999ebee45e1ec9f2b1a

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-10 03:18:57.000000000', 'files': ['glance/location.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_images_resource.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Python3: fix glance.tests.unit.v2.test_images_resource

Two issues here:
- jsonutils.dump_as_bytes should be used since request.body needs to be
  set to bytes;
- in Python 3, calling "del o[:]" makes us end up in __delslice__ with
  "i" and "j" being None, hence the little trick in glance/location.py.

Change-Id: Iff191305ab55f67801183127077fc8ae9738e763
'}]
commit_message:
Python3: fix glance.tests.unit.v2.test_images_resource

Two issues here:
- jsonutils.dump_as_bytes should be used since request.body needs to be
  set to bytes;
- in Python 3, calling "del o[:]" makes us end up in __delslice__ with
  "i" and "j" being None, hence the little trick in glance/location.py.

Change-Id: Iff191305ab55f67801183127077fc8ae9738e763

subject: create actions when creating jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-11-12 17:11:30.000000000', 'files': ['freezer_api/common/utils.py', 'tests/test_jobs.py', 'tests/test_utils.py', 'freezer_api/api/v1/jobs.py'], 'message': 'create actions when creating jobs

When creating a job, the api manages the actions contained
therein.
This is to enforce any action in any job to have an action_id
so that the editing from the web-ui is supported.

The behavior is the following:

  - an action with no action_id is created with new action_id
  - an action with a new action_id is created with that action_id
  - an action with an existing action_id is compared to the action
    already existing in the action db.
    If the action is different, it is inserted with a new action_id

Change-Id: I436a35efce87968def92f41c4e66bda0beabc677
'}]
commit_message:
create actions when creating jobs

When creating a job, the api manages the actions contained
therein.
This is to enforce any action in any job to have an action_id
so that the editing from the web-ui is supported.

The behavior is the following:

  - an action with no action_id is created with new action_id
  - an action with a new action_id is created with that action_id
  - an action with an existing action_id is compared to the action
    already existing in the action db.
    If the action is different, it is inserted with a new action_id

Change-Id: I436a35efce87968def92f41c4e66bda0beabc677

commit_message:
Delete the gate-grenade-dsvm-ironic-sideways job

This job only runs in stable/juno and was meant to test the
transition from nova baremetal to ironic, which people should have
done by now.

Also, the job appears to be busted in stable/juno and it's blocking
things from getting into the final 2014.2.4 release before we EOL
the branch, so let's delete it now.

Change-Id: I7128f4c6bbcf2250d4e57d214d04086ea4db542e

subject: Use keystoneauth to create a Session
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-11-11 17:51:26.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'magnumclient/common/httpclient.py', 'magnumclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'magnumclient/tests/v1/test_client.py', 'magnumclient/tests/test_shell_args.py', 'magnumclient/v1/client.py'], 'message': "Use keystoneauth to create a Session

All client interactions should actually flow through a keystoneauth
Session. Add the parameter for a user to pass one in, but support
the old style of direct parameters too. A followup patch will add
os-client-config support to the shell, so add that to requirements.txt
instead of keystoneauth directly to look forward.

Also, trim unneeded things from requirements.txt because we're adding
os-client-config which pulls in various things.

Closes-Bug: #1514733
Change-Id: I88b1d0e4e119429599dec75c5db24237a92edcec
"}]
commit_message:
Use keystoneauth to create a Session

All client interactions should actually flow through a keystoneauth
Session. Add the parameter for a user to pass one in, but support
the old style of direct parameters too. A followup patch will add
os-client-config support to the shell, so add that to requirements.txt
instead of keystoneauth directly to look forward.

Also, trim unneeded things from requirements.txt because we're adding
os-client-config which pulls in various things.

Closes-Bug: #1514733
Change-Id: I88b1d0e4e119429599dec75c5db24237a92edcec

The USER operation affects all docker commands after it. This causes a
problem with our {{ include_footer }} implementation since commands in
that footer may require elevated permissions to perform.

In the current implementation I can no longer remove my proxy settings

Change-Id: I9b2bab5a15f595f6d52a46c64ddf59ba5608b938
Partially-Implements: blueprint drop-root
'}]
commit_message:
Move USER operation after footer

The USER operation affects all docker commands after it. This causes a
problem with our {{ include_footer }} implementation since commands in
that footer may require elevated permissions to perform.

In the current implementation I can no longer remove my proxy settings
once the USER has been changed.

Change-Id: I9b2bab5a15f595f6d52a46c64ddf59ba5608b938
Partially-Implements: blueprint drop-root

commit_message:
Add override variables for plugin

Allow a plugin to override the admin and public addresses using
swift_hash:

- swift_hash['management_vip']
- swift_hash['public_vip']

Partially implements: blueprint detach-components-from-controllers
Change-Id: I90f727451081052c14e0bea896f6faab01f15486

commit_message:
Fixed conflics with slashes in requests

Requests containing slashes can confuse the routing of queries in the api.
Therefore slashes need to be encoded.

This add the decoding part to the receiving part.

Change-Id: Iabc4699dd082ae52db78455e79b7c9b3b6215393

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-12 16:33:47.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/v1/images.py'], 'message': "Invalid output running the command 'glance image-show <image_id>'

Running the command returns the string 'id' and fails on exception.
In function _image_meta_from_headers the meta variable was not properly
set because key was not lowercased. Converting key to lowercase solves
the problem.

NOTE: this is a compatibility fix for urllib3 >= 1.11

Closes-Bug: #1487645
Co-Authored-by: Flavio Percoco <flavio@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1b0b327163577585becb5e762536058d21dc1c98
(cherry picked from commit 2c7da7cb6077b89a7e195f76ed092ea7dfe65e02)
"}]
commit_message:
Invalid output running the command 'glance image-show <image_id>'

Running the command returns the string 'id' and fails on exception.
In function _image_meta_from_headers the meta variable was not properly
set because key was not lowercased. Converting key to lowercase solves
the problem.

NOTE: this is a compatibility fix for urllib3 >= 1.11

Closes-Bug: #1487645
Co-Authored-by: Flavio Percoco <flavio@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1b0b327163577585becb5e762536058d21dc1c98
(cherry picked from commit 2c7da7cb6077b89a7e195f76ed092ea7dfe65e02)

Crochet', 'email': 'brad@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcrochet'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-21 20:04:57.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': "Include registry on update when other envs are specified

On an openstack overcloud deploy which results in a stack-update,
implicitly include overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml if the user
specifies any other custom environments. Do not include
overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml if the user specifies no extra
environments.

This solution would be an improvement over the current situation, but it
isn't perfect.

It does the right thing when:
- the user does an openstack overcloud with no environments specified
- the user does an openstack overcloud with all custom environments
  specified

It will sometimes do the wrong thing when:
- the user specifies a partial list of custom environments (like -e
  do_my_custom_oneoff_thing.yaml)

Change-Id: I60fbf2182429f6bb83e000fc4d45269d7f83171b
Related-Bug: #1498607
Closes-Bug: #1504363
"}]
commit_message:
Include registry on update when other envs are specified

On an openstack overcloud deploy which results in a stack-update,
implicitly include overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml if the user
specifies any other custom environments. Do not include
overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml if the user specifies no extra
environments.

This solution would be an improvement over the current situation, but it
isn't perfect.

It does the right thing when:
- the user does an openstack overcloud with no environments specified
- the user does an openstack overcloud with all custom environments
  specified

It will sometimes do the wrong thing when:
- the user specifies a partial list of custom environments (like -e
  do_my_custom_oneoff_thing.yaml)

Change-Id: I60fbf2182429f6bb83e000fc4d45269d7f83171b
Related-Bug: #1498607
Closes-Bug: #1504363

commit_message:
Check flavor option before image checks

Currently flavor option is checked after performing the image checks
which results in unnecessary image checks even if flavor option is
not passed at all. Moved flavor option check at the beginning of the
method to eliminate the expensive operations performed as part of
image check.

Closes-Bug: #1502866
Change-Id: Ic68690b3d985d78ba0312bf5421989ccba7ceea8
